intro: Struthiola kilimandscharica, commonly known as the Kilimanjaro struthiola, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of East Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its foliage consists of narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Struthiola kilimandscharica is adapted to the harsh, cold conditions of its alpine habitat.
